title.narrative: Provide and enhancing access to primary healthcare and mental health services in Aleppo and Idleb through the PHCs centers and mobile clinics

description.narrative: The proposed project aims to contribute to a reduction in morbidity and mortality among the conflict-affected IDPs and host communities in the targeted areas of Idleb, Aleppo, in NW Syria. A total of 86,597 Individuals (men, women, boys, and girls). AL Resaa Foundation (RF) has. provided health service through SCHF grants TUR-19/3559/SA1/H/NGO/12616 until Feb 2020 through its health project for the PHCs in (Alresala camp, Afrin town, and Bulbul mobile clinic). In the project, RFs continue to provide health services to the same PHCs Alresala, Afrin, and the mobile clinic in Bulbul Due to the increasing number of IDPs. The mobile clinic in Bulbul Will provide the health service to the IDPs in Sharan in addition to one mobiles clinic Idled - Dana - Al Manarah camp The project will start on 1st April up to 30th October 2020. the target population will receive healthcare through facilities as follows - Two PHCs were located in Aleppo, (Alresala camp, Afrin town,) - Two mobiles clinic were located in Idleb, Aleppo. (Bulbul, Sharan) and Idleb - Dana - Al Manarah camp RF has worked to provide primary health care services that are the cornerstones of health services in any health system.
